description: Meet Note is an innovative note-taking app specifically designed to meet the needs of meetings, projects, and distributed teams. It offers a fast, user-friendly way to create and manage notes that are accessible on a local network or over the internet. With a strong focus on privacy and full GDPR compliance, users retain full control over their data. The app supports offline use and features a modular architecture that allows for future extensions and customizations. Key features include a custom editor for text and code, flexible export options, and real-time synchronization using Socket.IO. Thanks to its offline-first philosophy and intuitive design, Meet Note is ideal for both personal projects and professional teams.

features.title: Features
features.groups: Create and join groups via local IP or mDNS for easy network connections with no additional configuration required.
features.filters: Versatile search and filter options, including the ability to filter notes by title, activity, time, location, and required number of participants.
features.personalization: Personalize profiles and app settings, including theme switching (Light/Dark), primary and secondary colors, and custom adjustments.
features.posts: Create and edit notes with support for rich text, code blocks, tables, media embeds, and more. Notes can be exported as PDFs.
features.offline: Offline availability with full PWA (Progressive Web App) support. All data remains locally stored and accessible even without an internet connection.
features.access: Access control with planned password and token-based rooms that secure access to private notes and sessions.
features.sync: Real-time synchronization of notes via Socket.IO, ensuring changes are visible to all participants immediately.
features.export: Notes can be exported as PDFs, with planned export options to Markdown and OneNote.
features.files: File explorer for managing and sharing notes and other documents. Allows downloading notes and sharing files.
features.notifications: Push notifications for tasks and reminders that are shown directly on mobile devices.
features.security: Security features like HTTPS, bcrypt, and SHA-256 for secure transport and authentication. All data is stored locally and GDPR-compliant.
features.modular: Modular and extensible architecture that easily integrates future features and plug-ins.

steps.title: Install Node.js and npm
description: Visit the official Node.js website and download the LTS version (Long Term Support).
Install Node.js, which will automatically install npm as well.
After installation, check if Node.js and npm are installed correctly: `node -v` and `npm -v`.

steps.title: Clone the Repository
description: Open your terminal or command line.
Clone the Meet Note repository from GitHub: `git clone https://github.com/your-username/meet-note.git`.
Change into the project directory: `cd meet-note`.

steps.title: Install Dependencies
description: Install all required dependencies using npm: `npm install`.

steps.title: Start Development Server
description: To start the development server, run the following command: `npm run dev`.
The server should now be running, and you can access Meet Note through your browser using the local IP address of the host machine (the IP address displayed in the console).
Alternatively, you can also access the server using any local IP address or 'localhost' (127.0.0.1:6060) as long as you are on the host machine.

steps.title: Start Electron App (optional)
description: To run the desktop version with Electron, execute the following command: `npm run electron`.
The application will then open in a new window.

future_steps.title: Release for Windows, macOS, and Linux (Desktop)
description: In the future, Meet Note will be available as a standalone desktop app for Windows, macOS, and Linux.
The installation files will likely be offered as installers (Windows), DMG (macOS), and AppImage/DEB/RPM (Linux).
Visit the official Meet Note website or the GitHub release section to download the appropriate installation packages for your operating system.

future_steps.title: Release as App and on Play Store (Future)
description: In the future, Meet Note will also be available as a PWA (Progressive Web App) that can be installed on both iOS and Android.
The mobile app may also be available on the Google Play Store and Apple App Store with native support via CapacitorJS.
